result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan A Figueroa

8:32 AM Defendant Juan A Figueroa in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Juan A Figueroa.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Atty was just appointed on this case.
Deft has completed the Diversion program.
There is a question with regards to restitution.
Defense is requesting a new status date with the deft's appearance waived.
BTC: Deft's appearance is waived at the next date, matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim E.E (person, property, residence or family).

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan A Figueroa appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Juan A Figueroa. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
